intro: Coccoloba microneura, commonly known as the small-veined beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers and distinctive, palmate leaves with fine veins. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant foliage and delicate blooms. However, it is not commonly used in traditional medicine or agriculture.
